intro: Arkezostis gracillima, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy cyathium inflorescences. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, displaying a low, spreading habit. Its small, green leaves are opposite and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are inconspicuous but attract various pollinators. Arkezostis gracillima is often used in ornamental gardening due to its resilience and unique appearance.
